thread.title: Dead body discovered in porta-potty outside of Bengals stadium
thread.title_full: Dead body discovered in porta-potty outside of Bengals stadium

title: Dead body discovered in porta-potty outside of Bengals stadium
text:
Enlarge Image By John Breech Thursday October 8, 2015 8:01 PM 
CBSSPORTS - Authorities in Cincinnati are investigating an area around the Bengals stadium after a dead body was found in a porta-potty on Thursday. 
Police told Fox 19 that a construction worker found the body around 1:30 p.m. 
Cincinnati police Homicide Sgt. Mike Miller told the media that he believes the death is drug-related. 
Police have yet to ID the unidentified male. 
The death in the porta-potty marks the second time in five days that someone has died around Paul Brown Stadium. 
During the Bengals- Chiefs game on Sunday, a fan from Missouri died after collapsing in a stadium bathroom. The fan was rushed to a local hospital, where he was later pronounced dead. 
The Bengals will be back in Paul Brown Stadium this Sunday when they host the Seahawks in a game that kicks off at 1 p.m. Â©2015 by 10TV.com. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Currently in Columbus
